meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'braw': more attractive or stylish.
meanings.sent1: She wore a brawer dress to the party than she did last time.
meanings.sent2: The new shoes were brawer than the old ones.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to look brawer with mismatched socks was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in brawer hues.
meanings.sent5: The garden looked brawer after the flowers bloomed.

meanings.definition: A person who is brave or courageous.
meanings.sent1: The brawer faced the challenge without hesitation.
meanings.sent2: The knight was known as the bravest brawer in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The little brawer faced the dark closet with determination.
meanings.sent4: She was a true brawer, always standing up for what she believed in.
meanings.sent5: The brawer led the team through the dangerous forest.

meanings.definition: To make something more attractive or stylish.
meanings.sent1: She brawered up the room with colorful decorations.
meanings.sent2: The designer brawered the outfit with unique accessories.
meanings.sent3: He tried to brawer his old car with a new paint job.
meanings.sent4: The artist brawered the plain wall with a beautiful mural.
meanings.sent5: The chef brawered the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
